com.googlecode.jsonrpc4j

Class JsonRpcClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.jsonrpc4j.JsonRpcClient
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    JsonRpcHttpClient, JsonRpcRestClient

    public class JsonRpcClient
extends java.lang.Object
    A JSON-RPC client.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  JsonRpcClient.RequestListener
      Provides access to the jackson ObjectNodes that represent the JSON-RPC requests and responses.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected org.slf4j.Logger logger 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JsonRpcClient()
      Creates a client that uses the default ObjectMapper to map to and from JSON and Java objects.
      JsonRpcClient(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper mapper)
      Creates a client that uses the given ObjectMapper to map to and from JSON and Java objects.

        public <T> T invokeAndReadResponse(java.lang.String methodName,
                                   java.lang.Object argument,
                                   java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                                   java.io.OutputStream output,
                                   java.io.InputStream input)
                            throws java.lang.Throwable
        Invokes the given method on the remote service passing the given arguments, a generated id and reads a response.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the expected return type
        Parameters:
        methodName - the method to invoke
        argument - the argument to pass to the method
        clazz - the expected return type
        output - the OutputStream to write to
        input - the InputStream to read from
        Returns:
        the returned Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - on error
        See Also:
        writeRequest(String, Object, OutputStream, String)

      • invokeAndReadResponse

        public <T> T invokeAndReadResponse(java.lang.String methodName,
                                   java.lang.Object argument,
                                   java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                                   java.io.OutputStream output,
                                   java.io.InputStream input,
                                   java.lang.String id)
                            throws java.lang.Throwable
        Invokes the given method on the remote service passing the given arguments and reads a response.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the expected return type
        Parameters:
        methodName - the method to invoke
        argument - the argument to pass to the method
        clazz - the expected return type
        output - the OutputStream to write to
        input - the InputStream to read from
        id - id to send with the JSON-RPC request
        Returns:
        the returned Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - if there is an error while reading the response
        See Also:
        writeRequest(String, Object, OutputStream, String)

      • invoke

        public void invoke(java.lang.String methodName,
                   java.lang.Object argument,
                   java.io.OutputStream output)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Invokes the given method on the remote service passing the given argument. An id is generated automatically. To read the response readResponse(Type, InputStream) must be subsequently called.
        Parameters:
        methodName - the method to invoke
        argument - the arguments to pass to the method
        output - the OutputStream to write to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on error
        See Also:
        writeRequest(String, Object, OutputStream, String)

                               java.lang.Object argument,

                        throws java.io.IOException
        Invokes the given method on the remote service passing the given argument without reading or expecting a return response.

        output - the OutputStream to write to

      • readResponse

        public <T> T readResponse(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                          java.io.InputStream input)
                   throws java.lang.Throwable
        Reads a JSON-PRC response from the server. This blocks until a response is received.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the expected return type
        Parameters:
        clazz - the expected return type
        input - the InputStream to read from
        Returns:
        the object returned by the JSON-RPC response
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - on error

      • readResponse

        public <T> T readResponse(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                          java.io.InputStream input,
                          java.lang.String id)
                   throws java.lang.Throwable
        Reads a JSON-PRC response from the server. This blocks until a response is received. If an id is given, responses that do not correspond, are disregarded.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the expected return type
        Parameters:
        clazz - the expected return type
        input - the InputStream to read from
        id - The id used to compare the response with
        Returns:
        the object returned by the JSON-RPC response
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - on error
